refnamediv.refpurpose: Describe the properties of the different XML objects

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The nodes and their properties can be accessed and modified.

refsection.title: XML Document
XML Element
XML Attributes
refsection.para: A XML Attributes is a kind of hashtable which maps attributes name to attributes value. An attribute value can be accessed or modified in using the attribute name as field of this object or in using an index between 1 and attributes size.

refsection.title: XML Namespace
XML Node List
refsection.para: A XML Node List is a type used to enumerate the children of an element. Each element can be accessed with an integer index. Since this is a list, it is possible to make insertion of new element in it, in using double index.
The size of the list can be retrieved in using 'size' field.
The name or the contents of each node of the list can be retrieved in using 'name' or 'content' field.

refsection.title: XML XPath result set
refsection.para: A XML Node Set is an object returned by a XPath query. It is not possible to insert new elements or to replace existing ones. It is just possible to get them in using an integer index.
The size of the set can be retrieved with field 'size'.

refsection.title: XML Validation file
refsection.para: A XML Validation file is an object used to validate a document. It is possible to validate in using DTD, Relax NG or schema.
